What is the Islamic faith?: The Islamic faith is a monotheistic religion that follows the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad and the holy book of the Quran ğŸ•‹ğŸ“–ğŸ•Œ

What are the Five Pillars of Islam?: The Five Pillars of Islam are the fundamental practices that all Muslims are expected to follow: Shahada (declaration of faith), Salah (prayer), Zakat (charity), Sawm (fasting), and Hajj (pilgrimage to Mecca) ğŸ¤²ğŸ•‹ğŸ¤
The Five Pillars of Islam are the foundation of a Muslim's spiritual and social life, emphasizing the importance of faith, prayer, generosity, self-discipline, and unity ğŸ™ğŸ¤ğŸ’•
Who was Prophet Muhammad?: Prophet Muhammad was the last and final prophet of Islam, who received divine revelations from God through the Angel Gabriel ğŸ¤²ğŸ“–ğŸ•Œ

What is the significance of the Kaaba?: The Kaaba is a sacred shrine in the city of Mecca, towards which all Muslims face when praying. It symbolizes the unity of the Islamic faith and the devotion of the faithful to God ğŸ•‹ğŸ¤²ğŸ•Œ
The Kaaba is a symbol of the rich history and traditions of the Islamic faith, reminding us of the importance of humility, devotion, and unity in our lives ğŸ™ğŸŒŸğŸ’•
What is Zakat?: Zakat is one of the Five Pillars of Islam, which requires Muslims to give a percentage of their wealth to help those in need. It's a form of charity and social responsibility, promoting equality and compassion ğŸ¤²ğŸ¤ğŸ’•
Zakat is a means of purifying our wealth and helping those who are less fortunate, reflecting the Islamic values of generosity, empathy, and solidarity ğŸ™ğŸŒŸğŸ’«
What is Hajj?: Hajj is a pilgrimage to the city of Mecca in Saudi Arabia, which all Muslims are required to undertake at least once in their lifetime if they are physically and financially able. It's a symbol of unity, devotion, and humility ğŸ•‹ğŸ¤²ğŸŒŸ
